intro: Aspilia kunthiana, commonly known as the African torch or wild dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf structure. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Aspilia kunthiana is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands.
